Re: License #: CB391001684
Dear Shawna Henry:
Attached is the Original Licensing Study Report for the above referenced facility. The
study has determined substantial compliance with applicable licensing statutes and
administrative rules. Therefore, an original license is issued.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
question. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Holly Austin, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS & CONCLUSIONS
A. Physical Description of Facility
The agency is located within an office building shared with another program. The
agency worker and supervisor currently share an office within the building. They
have adequate furniture and equipment to perform independent living services.
The worker and supervisor's office also contains locked cabinets for file storage.
The agency office is located across the street from the agency owned apartment
4-plex which will be utilized for independent living youth to rent. The apartments
will not be staffed.
B. Program Description
The agency will provide independent living case management services to youth
who are not wards of MDHHS. The agency provides referrals, information,
services, and support for youths to assist in meeting their individual needs and
goals. Youths involved in the program receive help locating and/or enrolling in
educational or vocational programs and are assisted in obtaining and maintaining
employment, as appropriate. Agency staff help with education related to resume
writing, developing good work habits, completion of job applications, and
preparation for interviews. Youths in the program are linked to necessary health
services and will receive these services as part of their overall service provision.
Youth over the age of 18 (or youth who become 18 while in the program) will be
provided information and supportive services to access medical, dental, and
mental health services needed.
C. Rule/Statutory Violations
None
3

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on substantial compliance with the rules, it is recommended that a six-month
original license be issued.
July 17, 2024
